fields.description: The notification email brings information about the changes in the issue. It would be useful if the notification also shows the current status that the issues are at the moment. This will help in understanding where the issue is at the workflow.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
API methods such as userManager and groupManager use username as input sting, 
Customer using this API would like to use USerID or Key as usernames/groupnames may change but USerID remains constant.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide functionality for userManager and the groupManager to use USerID to key
fields.summary: Allow Jira API and methods to work with UserID instead of username

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Admins may want to hide the Jira version number due to audit requirements. The number visible on the UI, can be hidden, however, the once on the source code of the page cannot be removed. 
 !source.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Give admins the option to disable this.
 
h3. Workaround 

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I would like to be able to remove the Jira versions numbers from the source code of the page

It would be nice to be able to manage (create, edit, delete) these from within the project administration panel so that I don't need to make complicated scripts.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an admin, we want the ability to prevent changes made to certain statuses such as:
 * To Do
 * In Progress
 * Done

h3. Suggested Solution

Do not allow modifications to these statuses included in Jira by default or allow admins to lock down certain statuses preventing modifications.

If changes are made, they can be identified and reversed via the Audit Log.
fields.summary: As an admin, we want to prevent changes to certain Statuses

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary

Versions & licenses page in Jira 8.2.4 shows a compatibility error if Service Desk or Software is installed.

This is a regression from JRASERVER-69641.

h2. Steps to Reproduce

Upgrade to or install Jira Software 8.2.4 or Jira Service Desk 4.2.4.
h2. Expected Results

No warning nor an error is present as the applications are compatible.
h2. Actual Results

The below exception is displayed on the page
"Jira Core must be updated to be compatible with this version of Jira Software"

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h2. Notes

This issue was specific to the Jira 8.2.4 / Jira Service Desk 4.2.4 releases and is a separate one from the known https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63794 even though they both resulted in the same error.
fields.summary: Versions & licenses page in Jira 8.2.4 shows a compatibility error if Service Desk or Software is installed.

fields.description:
h4. *What is the problem*

Jira support zip includes three thread dump but they are not particularly useful due to the following reasons.
 * *Lack of time accuracy* - thread dump is a moment in time snapshot of threads activity. To be useful, it must be captured precisely at the time of a problem or otherwise it can be misleading. The current implementation doesn't allow enough timing precision for troubleshooting a problem
 * *Lack quantity control* - The quantity of the thread dump must be proportionate to the problem behavior. e.g., troubleshooting 15 second slowdown would require 5 thread dump taken with 2 second interval to give a clear picture of what happened during the 15 second slowdown. 

h4. *Impact of this problem*

Administrator often think the thread dump included in the support zip are valid and rely on that to troubleshoot performance problem. This makes the Support team had to explain the difference between the thread dump captured by the support zip, and the manual thread dump generation 
h4. *What to improve*

From the support standpoint, there is very little upside from having the current thread dump implementation, and it's probably raised more questions than answer.

Ideally we should improve the tool to address the above gaps, or otherwise remove it from the support zip (and rely on native thread dump tooling which is more accurate)
fields.summary: Remove thread dump from support zip

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira exposes embedded Crowd REST resources (i.e. /rest/usermanagement/1) along with Jira REST resources. However, some of these resources are not implemented in Jira, see [NoopForgottenLoginManager|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/8.5.0/com/atlassian/jira/crowd/embedded/NoopForgottenLoginManager.html].

With the current implementation of this class, the REST requests return various codes indicating successful processing (i.e. methods with void return types (see below for an example) return HTTP [204|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/204] that indicated success because *NoopForgottenLoginManager* does not throw exceptions.

However, according to REST conventions, these methods shall return HTTP 405 _Method Not Allowed_ response status code, which indicates that the request method is known by the server but is not supported by the target resource (see discussion of response codes [405|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/405] and [501|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/501].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a vanilla Jira installation, go *gg* > *User directories* page, click *Jira User Server* on the left-hand side menu and create an application definition. Define a username and password (*username/passw0rd*) at this step which will be used on next step
 # send a REST request using username/password above to Jira like below for an existing user (i.e. *admin*) like below
{code:bash}
curl -i -u username:passw0rd -X POST <JIRA_BASE_URL>/rest/usermanagement/1/user/mail/password?username=admin --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}

h3. Expected Results

We receive an HTTP 405 response
h3. Actual Results

We receive an HTTP 204 response, indicating a password reset mail has been sent to this user, however, no such mail is sent
h3. Workaround

Use similar REST API that's provided by JIRA [User REST endpoint|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.0/#api/2/user]
fields.summary: Calling unimplemented methods in Embedded Crowd endpoints exposed by Jira shall return an error instead of success codes

* No option to add attachments:
**  !Link.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to add attachments to comments in link issues tab

fields.description:
h3. Description
When a user get's deactivated in Jira, if the user ticked the "Remember my Login", it will take the expiry time configured for it until the user's session is finished. In the meantime, the user session in the browser will persist.

h3. Request
In some companies, it can happen that the IT department is requested to deactivate an account without the employee knowing yet, and it would be better if the user session was terminated upon deactivation so avoid any issues.
fields.summary: Kill the user's session and Remember my Login token upon deactivation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding an image attachment with a '+' in the file name to a comment in Visual Mode  results in a file name with a space instead of a plus in the markup and consequently the image is not rendered after the comment is saved. The same applies to the Description field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a comment on an issue
 # Add an image with '+' in the name using the *Visual* editor
!create_comment.png|thumbnail!
 # Click *Add* to save the comment


h3. Expected Results
* The image renders inline in the comment

h3. Actual Results
* Broken image icon
!saved_comment.png|thumbnail!
* *Text* editor shows that the image file name has been saved with a space instead of a plus.
!space.png|thumbnail!


h3. Workaround
* Change the file name to not contain '+' _before_ attaching it.
* Go to the *Text* editor and correct the file name there. It then renders correctly.
fields.summary: Rendering of an image attachment with '+' in the file name in a comment breaks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding an image attachment by drag and drop into a comment, then resizing it by clicking and dragging will break the image.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # copy an image, and past it into the comment section
 # *resize* (click and drag) it before sharing with the customer
 # image is broken in issue view
 # image is broken in portal view

!JCPphmPy77.gif|width=371,height=579!
h3. Expected Results

Image is view-able from customer portal
h3. Actual Results

Image is broken when viewing from the customer portal
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copy and pasting an image in a comment box, then resizing it by click and drag breaks the image

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

IF User is logged in with Administrative access a "You have temporary access to administrative functions" banner is displayed, but the users Administrative access is removed by a different user the logged-in user loses his administrative privileges but it doesnot remove the "You have temporary access to administrative functions" banner from the users browser session.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User1 logs in with Administrative privileges (member of Jira-administrators) group.
# User1 against administrative access by clicking on Administration and providing credentials 
# "You have temporary access to administrative functions" banner is displayed
# Access some other non-administrative functions eg search issues 
# The banner is still displayed.
# User2 removes user1 from Jira-administrator group in a different browser
# User1 will lose Administrative privileges (without requiring to log in again)but the banner will still remain.

h3. Expected Results
Banner also to be removed with loss of Administrative privileges
h3. Actual Results

The banner is not removed when Administrative privileges are removed.

h3. Workaround
# Disable secure administrator login using [Configuring secure administrator sessions \- Disabling secure administrator sessions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/configuring-secure-administrator-sessions-861254024.html?#Configuringsecureadministratorsessions-Disablingsecureadministratorsessions]
# Ask user to re-login to Jira
fields.summary: Removing Administrative access from a user when he is logged in doesnot remove the "You have temporary access to administrative functions" banner

Customer would like to change the size of workflow transition screen.

Screen size remains as it is and cannot be changed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Due to the following bugs, a cache flush event can cause cascading performance issue on  Data Center. 
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61166
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66013

As such, we would like to make the cache flush event debug as the default logger in Jira, so that administrator can track the event and correlate with other performance metrics (ie, response time)

The debug logger consist of one line per event as below.
{code}
awk -F ']' '{if ($0 ~/was flushed/) {print $2}}' atlassian-jira.log | sort | uniq -c | sort -n -k 1,1 | less
   1  Cache UpmPluginLicenseCache was flushed
   1  Cache UpmRoleBasedMetadataCache was flushed
   1  Cache com.atlassian.upm.license.role.jira.GlobalPermissionUserCountCache was flushed
   4  Cache com.atlassian.jira.project.version.CachingVersionStore.cache.versionsByName was flushed
   4  Cache com.atlassian.jira.project.version.CachingVersionStore.cache.versionsByProjectId was flushed
 970  Cache com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecuritySchemeManagerImpl.projectSchemeCache was flushed
 970  Cache com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecuritySchemeManagerImpl.schemeIdToSecuritiesCache was flushed
 970  Cache com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecuritySchemeManagerImplsecurityLevelToPermissionsCache was flushed
1085  Cache com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecurityLevelManagerImpl.projectAndUserToSecurityLevelCache was flushed
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Setup  3 nodes data center
* Create 5000 custom field (to exagerate the prorblem)
* Change a customfield configuration 
* Notice slow drop on performance across nodes due to cache flush event

h3. Expected Results

The debug log should be enabled by default since it is necessary and is not verbose

h3. Actual Results

The debug is not enabled hence we don't know if there is cache flush event happened

h3. Workaround

Enable DEBUG logging manually (see JRASERVER-66031 for context)
* navigate to Administration > Logging and Profiling 
* Click *Configure debug for new package*
* Add  DEBUG on com.atlassian.cache.event
fields.summary: Make DEBUG com.atlassian.cache.event as default logging

fields.description:
We have created a form in Confluence and we are wishing to fetch all the application names from JIRA instance in this Confluence instance .

Next, we would like to then select application name from the drop down list that we will be having all the application names from JIRA instance. And then to show that selected data in the data sheet created.

Could you kindly suggest us of a way to get this requirement done.
fields.summary: Is there any way of getting all the application list from the JIRA Instance in Confluence Instance?

fields.description:
Jira Server supports SMTPS but the difference between SMTPS (465/tcp) and MSA(587/tcp) is that in MSA case the mail-server expects some kind of preliminary authentication.

Rather than allowing a username and password to be entered for authentication, Jira uses  user=jira, password=<null>.

We would like Jira Server to support the configuration necessary to use the MSA protocol.
fields.summary: Make Jira Server compatible with the MSA protocol

fields.description:
As a Jira administrator, I would like Jira to generate independent issue keys for different issue types, for instance, if we consider Project A and the task, story and epic issue types:

The first task created would be PATASK-1, the second PATASK-2, and so on. However, the enumeration should be independent for each issue type, so when the first epic created would still be PAEPIC-1, and the first story created would be PASTORY-1.

That change would be highly beneficial as it would allow my teams to identify an issue's type by just looking at its key.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin I would like Jira to generate different issue keys for different issue types.

fields.description:
In very big Jira implementations, enabling Webhooks on "Update tickets" events could kill Jira's performance, because the JQLs engine starts to be flooded with tons of queries.

 

As a user, I would like to narrow the webhook scope before executing any JQL with some fixed parameters, like issue type list, project lists, the priorities...
fields.summary: Enable static filters in Webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, there is no limit in linking an issue to another whether it goes to a thousand or more. Due to this, it will be hard to browse the list of tickets linked in the "Issue Links" section. In addition, this has been reported that it will cause a performance problem when those tickets are one of the results when searching for issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
To have an option to limit linking an issue in a single ticket. To have the number to be customizable will be great as well.
fields.summary: Option to limit the number of Issue Link in a Ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
impossible to reorder columns into issue navigator when more than 10 fields are added into the list view mode 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 20 random custom fields
 # In the Issue Navigator switch to view mode and add all the custom fields to the column
 # try to drag and drop the last columns into the desired position
 # while dropping the column the mouse pointer doesn't enhance the desired column and then the column is not moved
 # while reducing the number of columns into the view sometimes the column is moved but not in the desired position but at the first place

Tested in Chrome 78 and Firefox 70

h3. Expected Results
it should be possible to reorder columns at the desired position
h3. Actual Results
impossible to move columns at the desired position

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: impossible to reorder columns into issue navigator when more than 10 fields are added into the list view mode

fields.description:
As per [JRASERVER\-34927: Automatically include attachment link in attachment comment (fixed in Jira Server and Data Center 6.5\-OD\-06, 7.0.0)|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34927] which was rolled out a few years ago, each time an attachment is added to an issue, Jira will automatically add the link/thumbnail in the comment field.

h3. Suggestion
It would be great if users can choose to disable this feature (make it optional at a certain level, let's say per project or globally). If it is disabled, there will be no comment generated.

h3. Workaround
Use the attachment option from the comment panel on the issue view screen instead:
# In the comment panel at the bottom of the page, click on the paperclip icon to pull the attachment option. Click *+ Browse* to attach a file.
 !attach-1.jpg|thumbnail! 
# Wait for a while until the file is attached successfully. A notification on the top right will appear indicating file is attached.
 !attach-2.jpg|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to change the issue type to another one with a different configuration (e.g required fields) in view mode or edit mode, the operation is not prohibited. However, in Jira 7, this kind of operation is not permitted which makes more sense to avoid any misconfiguration in the target issue type.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field (Eg, text field).
 # Configure the custom field to only apply to Bug issue type.
 # Set this custom field *required* in the field configuration.
 # Add the custom field to the used screens.
 # Create an issue as Task.
 # Change the issue's issue type value to Bug in View mode or Edit mode.

h3. Expected Results

You should not be able to update the issue type since Task and Bug are not sharing the same configuration.

I tried to reproduce the issue in Jira 7.13.11 and here are the expected results:
 * Tried to edit the issue and change it from "Bug" to "Task" in *edit mode*:

!EditBugEditMode.png|width=250,height=136!
 * Tried to update an issue and change it from "Task" to "Bug" in *view mode*, you can see that the "Bug" issue type doesn't show in the list.

!EditTaskViewMode.png|width=249,height=134!
h3. Actual Results

In view mode: I am able to change the issue type from Task to Bug without being prompted to insert/update the required field that I created for Bug.

In edit mode: I am able to change the issue type from Task to Bug, and I can see the required field added to the edit screen to be updated.
h3. Workaround

Currently, the best way to update the issue type, in general, is by moving the issue (as in Jira 7) to make sure no required field/configuration is missed during the transition.
fields.summary: Switching to an issue type with a different configuration is not prohibited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After parsing Jira's gadget feed in Confluence, gadgets not listed on "Select macro" page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence, go to system settings > External Gadgets > Gadget Feeds
 # Add new Jira's gadget feed URL in format: {{<baseURL>/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed}} 
 #* example:  [https://jiraserver/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed|http://jiraserver/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/feed]
 # Once the feed gets added, go to some Confluence page > Click "+" icon > Other macros (e.g. Jira Sprint Burndown)
 # Wait about *1 - 2 hours* and then refresh the Confluence page

h3. Expected Results

Jira gadgets are listed on the feed and can be selected in Confluence macros

h3. Actual Results

Jira gadgets are not listed in Confluence macros.

h3. Workaround
Adding specific gadgets' URLs to Confluence will fix the issue.

h4. Environment

Jira that got upgraded to version 8.4.x or 8.5.x
h4. Notes
(!) In some situations, Confluence is not even able to parse the gadget feed from Jira. The following message arises in the UI:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 Temporary workaround to parse the feed is to restart Confluence and then, Jira will be able to parse the gadget feed (but only for some time)
(!) in some case cases, you will be able to add the gadget from the feed, and it will work initially, but it will stop working in 1h (no changes were made during this time on Jira and Conf side).
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-20 at 4.06.15 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: After parsing Jira's gadget feed in Confluence, gadgets not listed on "Select macro" page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding HTML code to an announcement banner, if there is any syntax issue, the whole JIRA UI will be impacted and users might not be able to login at all if the login form is hidden because of the announcement banner.
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
 - Go to ⚙ > System > Announcement Banner
 - Enter the following content in the banner field. (!) Note that the syntax is incorrect, as the closing comment tag is missing a dash character:
{code:java}
<!-- Commented out code ->
{code}

 - Click on the "Set banner" button
 - Log out of Jira and try to log back in
 - Notice that the login form is completely gone and that it is impossible to log in:
 !MissingLoginForm.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested solution

2 options:
 - either add a syntax checker before allowing the admin user to save the banner by clicking on the "Set banner" button
 - or provide the admin user with a preview of the announcement banner, so that they can see the impact of it before clicking on the "Set banner" button
fields.summary: Check announcement banner syntax before saving it, or show a preview

fields.description: It would be great if `rest/api/latest/project` will return list of projects with their activity status - active/archived

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users that have updated to the latest ATST version available in the marketplace, that was 1.23.1, may receive a failed health check regarding JVM Code Cache memory.

The failed health check error shows up regardless of the Code Cache memory size specified in the JVM parameters.

* Due to high false positives, *the health check was removed* in ATST _1.23.3_. See [focusedCommentId=2348387|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70281?focusedCommentId=2348387&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2348387] from the team. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This problem has multiple causes, so isn't directly reproducible.
h3. Expected Results

The troubleshooting tools only show up an error in Code Cache memory size when there's an actual problem
h3. Actual Results

An error is displayed even though the code cache size is adequate
h3. Workaround
 * The actual ReservedCodeCacheSize may still be too small. Increase it by following [Full Code Cache Size Causes Jira Server to Crash or Perform Slowly|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/full-codecache-causes-jira-server-to-crash-or-perform-slowly-314447083.html] article.
 * Then, clear catalina.out log file under *<JIRA_INSTALL>/logs* directory because the health check may be responding to outdated messages in. Here is the sample log:
{code}
...
...
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: CodeCache is full. Compiler has been disabled.
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: Try increasing the code cache size using -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=
CodeCache: size=524288Kb used=503421Kb max_used=518081Kb free=20866Kb
{code}
 * Restart Jira node(s)

(!) If there is still a health check warning although ReserveCodeCacheSize is increased, raise a ticket to Atlassian Support for further investigation.
fields.summary: JVM Code Cache memory check is failing in ATST version 1.23.1

fields.description:

Suggestion:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Webhooks are triggered for the worklog events regardless of the JQL specified
h3. How to replicate
 # Navigate through {{Jira Administration > System > WebHooks}} and create a new one (+ Create a WebHook)
 # Specify the project in the JQL such as \{{project = "X", }}include "issue link" created / updated, and save it
 # Access any issue from other projects rather than "Project X" and create an issue link to another issue rather than "Project X"
 # The WebHook is triggered without respecting the JQL of step 2

h3. Notes

This is not happening for other events such as "Issue: Created"
h3. Workaround

Create a rule using the [Automation for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira-server?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview] plugin to fire the webhook whenever it matches the conditions:
 * _Trigger_ [_Issue Linked and Issue LInked Deleted_|https://blog.codebarrel.io/how-to-use-the-linked-issue-trigger-in-automation-for-jira-1616b68c2d6e]
 * _Condition [Issue Fields Condition or JQL condition|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/conditions-993924794.html] to validate the information_
 * _Action [Send outgoing web request|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/actions-993924834.html]_ 

h5. Example of Automation for Jira rule
|!image-2021-06-16-14-42-19-280.png|width=761,height=409!|

_(i) You can also [Smart Values|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-general/] and [Branch Rules|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/work-with-related-issues/] to manipulate the linked issue information_
fields.summary: WebHooks based on "issue link" updates do not respect the JQL filter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Date Created and Date Updated are system fields populated by Jira.  It is great that the Jira allows users to update the fields via CSV import to correct historic data in some instances.  It also allows users to change the dates to a future date which caused confusion and incorrect reporting in some scenario.  
h3. Suggested Solution

Introduce data validation check for CSV import to ensure the system dates are not set in the future.
fields.summary: Verify "Date Created" and "Date Updated" to be always less than today's date

fields.description: Currently only Jira administrators can see who released a version by using the audit log. A permission could be added to allow other users (such as project admins and scrum masters) to view the release history.
fields.summary: Allow non-admin users to view who moved a version to Released

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

The Jira Server mobile app needs to check that you're running a compatible version of Jira Software before it can log you in. To do this the app needs to access _<jira-base-url>/server-info>_ without any kind of authentication. 
 The problem here is that under some environments (like Azure Application Proxy) this endpoint cannot be accessed without authentication.
h3. Suggestion

There are two potential options here:
 * Allow the Jira Mobile app to configure authentication to access this endpoint
 * Make this access optional, so the application can connect with the server without sending anonymous requests.

h3. Workaround
 * For MDM with AppConfig customers:
 ** Use _skipInfo_ parameter in order to skip _<jira-base-url>/server-info_ call -> https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/mobile-device-management-mdm-979410911.html
fields.summary: Improve Jira Mobile access to server-info endpoint

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to configure the time-out leniency for JSD Mail Handlers. Jira Core's handlers can be configured manually, however.

It would be a good addition to manually set the time out period so administrators can fine tune it considering network constraints.
fields.summary: Ability to fine tune Service Desk incoming mail handler timeout

fields.description:
h3. Description
In some occasions, it is possible that  any newly created projects in Jira are not being associated with their default priority scheme and are, therefore, being created without any priority scheme.
This causes an issue described in the article [Jira server throws jira-project-config-plugin error when editing the Priority Scheme of a new project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-server-throws-jira-project-config-plugin-error-when-editing-the-priority-scheme-of-a-new-project-945524522.html].

Usually, this is caused by the third-party plugin [Project Configurator|https://productsupport.adaptavist.com/browse/PCDEV-1254], however, it would be interesting if Jira could identify this behaviour and fix it automatically or notify the customer about it before causing an issue.

h3. Environment
- Jira Server 8.5.0
- Usually coming from Cloud migration, or after a project migration using the Project Configurator plugin (which is recommended by Atlassian in a few documentations)
fields.summary: Prevent that Priority Schemes are not associated to a newly created project by default

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Since Jira 8, admins are able to choose notifications to be batched, causing a single notification to be sent for multiple events. Currently, this is limited to some system events, and custom events that might've been added by admins are not picked up by the batch notification, generating a notification of its own.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow admins to add custom events to be picked up by batch notifications.

h3. Why this is important

Customers might have a deeply customized environment, where multiple custom events are used, which might take a majority of the notification noise in the instance. Allowing admins to choose which custom events are batched can help with reducing the noise.
fields.summary: Allow admins to add Custom Events to Batch Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
For Service Desk Customers, the ability to search the other customer in the project through the Customer Portal (Share Request and Approval) is configured in each project which is:
- [Choose who customers can share requests with|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/managing-access-to-your-service-desk-939926273.html#Managingaccesstoyourservicedesk-Choosewhocustomerscansharerequestswith]

In comparison with standard JIRA Users or Users that has Application Access, such config is controlled in "Browser Users" Global Permission. But, the description of the permission does not specifically mention that it will not affect the customers which can be confusing for admin that expect to add the customer group to this permission to be able to search for users.

h3. Suggested Solution
To specifically mentioned in the description that it will not affect Service Desk Customers like:
bq. Ability to select a user or group from a popup window as well as the ability to use the 'share' issues feature. Users with this permission will also be able to see names of all users and groups in the system. *This does not affect Service Desk Customers*, for this, check the documentation [Choose who customers can share requests with|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/managing-access-to-your-service-desk-939926273.html#Managingaccesstoyourservicedesk-Choosewhocustomerscansharerequestswith].
fields.summary: "Browse Users" Global Permission to give a clear distinction that it is not affecting Service Desk Customers

fields.description:

Currently, Jira provides only Docker packages however there is not support for deploying Jira in Kubernetes.

h3. Why this is important

It significantly simplifies the deployment and upgrades of Jira Server for the customer environments running in [Kubernetes|https://kubernetes.io/].

fields.description:
Users would like to have functionality to import data from a .csv file on "create sub-task" screen, this is in order to have option to create the sub-task by importing data from a .csv file.

On a similar note, users also expect to have functionality to export on the "create sub-task" screen to export the sub-tasks in .csv format.

Currently we don't have such options, we have option to export individual sub-task when we view any sub-task, but it does not have .csv format. We can only export issues in .csv format from issue search screen.

fields.description:
+*Description:*+

Every time when users edit a workflow transition to modify/add/remove conditions, triggers or post-functions, a new browser tab is opened. Once the changes are published, current page goes back to the workflow screen. However, it doesn't refresh the original screen.

Regardless of what user does in the old tab becomes invalid and throws an error upon clicking links to suggest refreshing the page. However, users can continue with newly opened tab without any issue. 

To continue editing, user has to click the edit button again within the new tab, which will open one more tab and the chain continues. When users have multiple tests to do on workflows and won't close tab on every edit, they end up in large number of tabs (redundant efforts) and sometimes even browser crashes.

+*Steps to Reproduce:*+

1) Edit a workflow
2) Click on a transition
3) Click on one of the options links like conditions, triggers, post-functions.
4) Please go through the video attached, which is more elaborative.

+*Expected Results & Improvements:*+

1. Options associated workflow transitions should open in the same tab, as the old tab becomes useless after a typical workflow edit; even in the case of discarding any changes. Once the changes are published, they should reflect.

2. *An alternate option*, the new tab being opened for edit should be closed after the Publish or Discard buttons are pressed and the parent tab to be refreshed. To achieve this, we can think of providing these edit options as popup windows, once changes are made it automatically refreshes the workflow.

One other improvement, would be to make the workflow edit screen go back to the same view originally selected (in this case the Diagram view).
fields.summary: Ability to edit options associated with workflow transitions in same browser tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Timestamps in Jira are generated at the application level. When DB update transactions are executed by threads, any timestamps in transaction will already be generated and won't reflect the time the data was "committed" to the DB. 

It is impossible to compute deltas between two states of the data based on the timestamp info in the DB. 
h3. Suggested Solution
All Jira timestamps should reflect when the transaction was "committed". 
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Timestamps in the database should reflect the time the transaction was executed/committed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Documentation since Jira 7.8 shows advanced search options for [development components since Jira 7.8|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver0710/advanced-searching-development-fields-reference-973500715.html].

The query *{{development[pullrequests].merged}}* was only included in Jira 7.12 as per [Jira 7.12 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-12-x-release-notes-953676636.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using any Jira prior to 7.12, configure an application link with BitBucket;
# Merge pull requests;
# Attempt to query for:
{code}project = myProj and development[pullrequests].merged > 0{code}
# Note that the query fails with the following error:
{noformat}Valid property names for development[pullrequests] are 'all', 'open'{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The query returns issues with merged pull requests

h3. Actual Results
The JQL parameter does not exist.


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced search documentation shows incorrect queries for development tools

fields.description:

We have crossfunctional teams and therefore we are using the skillsexcessivley in order to identify bottle necks and or over capacity. This goes hand in hand with the individual capacity. 

We are using both functions in Portfolio v2 and would love to move to the improved interface of Portfolio v3, but because of these limitations we cannot migrate with losing a lot of our detailed planning and in the end the gloabl overview.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira is trying to do index recovery every time Jira is restarted in Standalone mode by reconciling the issues difference against DB.
 It has been noticed since Jira 8 was released, that logging for index recovery happens after every Jira restart.
 The recovery process does kick in even if the indexes are not corrupted and tries to recover issues with null keys and thus is returning zero ids.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira 8.5.0
 # create a project and start creating issues, transition one of them and add comments.
 # run a background re-indexing on the instance.
 # check the background reindexing logs.
 # enable debug logging on the package: *com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.IssueGenericValue* in the log4j.properties
 # do a restart and check the logs.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should have a clean start up, index recovery shouldn't be trying to deindex issues with zero ids.
 Background reindex number should match up without any discripancy.
h3. Actual Results

On start up Jira is trying to deindex issues with zero ids even though the database doesn't have any issues with zero ids.
 The below messages are shown in the Jira start up logs in atlassian-jira.log:
{noformat}
2019-11-13 14:42:34,466 Caesium-1-1 INFO      [c.a.jira.startup.IndexRecoveryLauncher] Running start-index-recovery
2019-11-13 14:42:34,789 Caesium-1-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Latest index date: {2019-11-04 13:30:15}, Latest DB date: {2019-11-04 13:30:15}
2019-11-13 14:42:34,790 Caesium-1-1 INFO      [c.a.jira.startup.IndexRecoveryLauncher] Indexing issues from=2019-11-04 13:30:15.0 to=Mon Nov 04 13:30:15 CET 2019 (time span of 314ms)
2019-11-13 14:42:34,791 Caesium-1-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Re-indexing issues from: 2019-11-04 13:30:15.0 to: Mon Nov 04 13:30:15 CET 2019 ...
...

[c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Reindexing 21 issues in the background.

[c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Reindexing 15 issues in the background completed in 234 millis

 * actual number of issues - _15_ (vs 21 in logs).

h3. Note:

The start-up logs don't appear all the time, though it could be reproduced eventually especially with large instances.
 Doing a Full foreground re-indexing helps to restore the index into a more tidy state, but changes to Jira issues will eventually cause indexes to have entries with null issue keys.
h3. Workaround: 

A background reindex should resolve the JQL search issues, but the ongoing task is to periodically clear the null values out of the DB. 

You can clear these out of the database by either:
 # running the integrity checker
 # deleting the null entries from the database:
 As always make sure you test these types of changes in a lower environment and make sure to back up the DB prior! :) 
 *validate the issues:*
{code:java}
SELECT id,issuenum,project FROM jiraissue WHERE issuenum IS NULL;{code}
*delete the issues*
{code:java}
delete FROM jiraissue WHERE issuenum IS NULL;{code}

fields.description:
As a Jira administrator, I would like to have the ability to restrict users' access to the instance. This would be extremely helpful for customers that have large and heavily customized environments. It is also worth mentioning potential benefits during upgrade processes:

Without this feature, users can log in before the administrators have the opportunity to re-apply modified files/content. Additionally, it is important to deny users access to the instance before plugins are correctly upgraded and post-upgrade checks have been performed, and functionalities have been tested and are ready for use. Furthermore, once the upgrade is completed, the integrations between Jira and other applications will be reestablished and that can be another potential source of issues in the future.

Also, for instances that have users worldwide in different timezones, it can be extremely difficult to program a maintenance window where no users will be accessing Jira. In some cases, these maintenance windows are used to perform system administration tasks such as the installation of new plugins, extracting data for year-end processing or auditing by regulatory agencies.

The current options available, outlined in the article: [Preventing users from accessing Jira applications during backups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/preventing-users-from-accessing-jira-applications-during-backups-938847685.html], are not feasible for some of our customers, as it can require network and security skills that may not be available when this functionality is needed.

Because of that, this feature could benefit these customers allowing them to restrict access to the instance through the User Interface, similarly to the Full Reindex process (that is already available), not allowing users to alter data inside the instance while the process is executed.
fields.summary: Restrict access to users through the User Interface

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During JIRA start there is code that attempts to recover JIRA's issues index to consistent state. As part of this process issues that are indexed but are no longer present in database are removed from index. There is a bug in that code that tries to load issues keys while they are not populated.

This bug manifests itself by following warnings in log:
{code:java}
2019-11-08 00:41:13,706 Caesium-1-2 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.jira.ofbiz.IssueGenericValue] Issue (id=0) has empty field 'num'. Returning null for 'key'.
{code}
or 
{code:java}
2019-11-07 16:05:39,909 Caesium-1-1 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.jira.ofbiz.IssueGenericValue] Issue (id=479837) has empty field 'num'. Returning null for 'key'.
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or delete some issues in Jira.
 # Restart Jira. 

h3. Expected Results
Index recovery should not generate errors.  This was fixed in version 6.4.5 but has resurfaced. 

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2019-11-08 00:41:13,010 Caesium-1-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Latest index date: {2019-11-01 17:24:01}, Latest DB date: {2019-11-01 17:24:01}
2019-11-08 00:41:13,011 Caesium-1-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.jira.startup.IndexRecoveryLauncher] Indexing issues from=2019-11-01 17:24:01.0 to=Fri Nov 01 17:24:01 GMT+00:00 2019 (time span of 0ms)
2019-11-08 00:41:13,012 Caesium-1-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.jira.startup.IndexRecoveryLauncher] Progress=60%, task=Recovering, message=Recovered added and updated issues
2019-11-08 00:41:13,580 Caesium-1-2 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.jira.ofbiz.IssueGenericValue] Issue (id=0) has empty field 'num'. Returning null for 'key'.
2019-11-08 00:41:13,705 Caesium-1-2 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.jira.ofbiz.IssueGenericValue] Issue (id=0) has empty field 'num'. Returning null for 'key'.
2019-11-08 00:41:13,706 Caesium-1-2 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.jira.ofbiz.IssueGenericValue] Issue (id=0) has empty field 'num'. Returning null for 'key'.
...
2019-11-08 00:43:13,706 Caesium-1-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.jira.startup.IndexRecoveryLauncher] Progress=80%, task=Recovering, message=Cleaned removed issues
2019-11-08 00:43:13,706 Caesium-1-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.jira.startup.IndexRecoveryLauncher] Finished start-index-recovery
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* (i) This is safe to ignore those messages in the context of Index recovery (/) 
* In another context it might indicate a problem. 

h3. Workaround
To temporary resolve, run the database integrity checker and then a full Lock & Rebuild of the index.
fields.summary: On startup, Jira logs "Issue X has empty field 'num'. Returning null for 'key'."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Scheduler from ATST app {{com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.scheduler.CustomisationsCheckScheduler:job}} failed due to binary incompatibilities.

The effect of this bug is that some information about changed files is not presented to the user when upgrading Jira. It does not cause any problems during normal operation or upgrade.

h3. Environment 
* Jira 7.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Stop jira
# Install ATST App version 1.20.3 from  https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217696/troubleshooting-and-support-jira/version-history
# Start Jira 
# The error is raised, see below

h3. Expected Results
No error is raised

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
Caesium-1-3 ERROR ServiceRunner [c.a.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.scheduler.CustomisationsCheckScheduler:job' failed due to binary incompatibilities
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils.lineIterator(Ljava/io/InputStream;Ljava/nio/charset/Charset;)Lorg/apache/commons/io/LineIterator;
at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.pup.BaselineHashesService$MultiHashAccessor.lambda$new$2(BaselineHashesService.java:72)

fields.description: As a security manager, I need to manage risk to my information assets. Doing this effectively requires timely notice of all vulnerabilities. Additionally, the technical updates that I am currently subscribed to, have little to no information regarding security issues (other than the advisories).

fields.description:
It would be great if Jira could handle loss of database connections during a long re-index operation.

Currently, if db fails and returns in a few minutes, Jira will continue, but finish with an incomplete re-index operation that needs to be done again.

We should either fail immediately or pick up and re-index all the issues properly.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When running a basic search, the criteria's options do not show in alphabetical order. However, they are alphabetically sorted in the advanced search. This is applicable for multiple native fields such as Priority and Status.
(Attaching screenshots)



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on "Basic" Under Issues>Search for issues.
 # Select Priority or Status to list the options.

h3. Expected Results
 # The options should be listed in alphabetical order.

h3. Actual Results
The options are not showing in alphabetical order, for "Status" for example it's random.

h3. Workaround
Use advanced search if the list of options is too long.
fields.summary: Criteria's options in Basic Search not sorted in alphabetical order

fields.description:
When upgrading Jira the entityengine component ("DatabaseUtil") will create new columns for added entity fields.
Currently this will create a new "ALTER TABLE" statement for each new column.

Most database engines have to rewrite the whole existing table to add new columns.
Performing this complete table rewrite for every column take quite some time.
Jira could create all new columns in a single SQL "ALTER TABLE" so the database can perform the whole table upgrade with a single table rewrite.

For example the "Issue" entity (a fairly central concept for Jira) received three new fields in our upgrade from 7.6 to 8.5 and therefore had to be rewritten three times.
fields.summary: Combining schema modification DDL commands for improved performance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Project copy based on existing configurations performs very slow or fails when there are custom fields configured per project context.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Prepare 30-40 custom fields and configure them for selected project.
 # Create number of issues for this project (10-20)
 # Provide constant background load (20 - 30 users) that retrieves random issues (via REST service /issue/\{key})
 # Run concurrent project create operation based on existing configuration (with per context fields) on behalf of ~7 users  

h3. Expected Results

New projects are crated successfully , there are no timeouts/errors for background  issue read operations

h3. Actual Results

Threads locked on getContexts operation should be observed within thread dump
{noformat}
sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.doAcquireSharedInterruptibly(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:997)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Server*. Using *Jira Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73372].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

With the addition of the JQL function [issueLinkType|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-fields-reference-939938743.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-issuelinktypeIssuelinktype], Jira Server now has the ability to let users search by the issue link's Name, Outward Description, and/or Inward description. The problem with this is that by default the issue link type 'Blocks' also has an outward description by the same name 'blocks'. Since these are the same, you can't actually only get back results with that outward description. Instead you get back all issues with that link name, which includes both outward ('blocks') and inward ('is blocked by').
 By default only the Blocks link type has a description with the same value as the link Name. The suggested solution would be to have new Jira sites use a different change the outward link name from 'blocks' to something different such as 'blocking'.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link one issue to another with the blocks issue link type
 # Search JQL with:
{code:java}
issueLinkType = "blocks" 
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Would expect to only get back a single issue with that outward description of 'blocks'
h3. Actual Results

You actually will get back all the issues of that link name (both inward and outward description) because the term that is being searched here matches the link name.
h3. Workaround

You can edit the link descriptions so that they do not exactly match the name of the link type. For example you could change the outward link name from 'blocks' to something different such as 'blocking'. This would at least permit users to make these specific JQL searches based on the description and not the name.
fields.summary: Issue Link names should be different from their descriptions

fields.description: It would be great if Jira has an option to gather together all notification from all updated tickets and send just one e-mail to the user. (At this moment, Jira gathers all updates made just by +one ticket+ and sends it to the user.)
fields.summary: Improving Batching email notifications

fields.description: Currently I look at an issue that was modified last Friday and it says modified two days ago. I want the option to see exactly what time it was modified.
fields.summary: Give the option to see exact time issue was modified

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When  you add the linked Issues field as required on a screen, this does indeed become required. However, setting the links under this is not enforced. Therefore this makes the Linked Issues fields being required unhelpful.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a field configuration and make the Linked Issues field required
# Go to the screen in Jira
# Set a value for the Issue Issue Eg: Duplicated By
# Do not add any issues on the links below that
# Try to edit/create the issue

h3. Expected Results

Jira will ask you to enter the issues too

h3. Actual Results

Jira creates/edits the tickets without any information on the linked issues. 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot made the 'Issues' field in linked issues a required field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When browsing for attachments in a comment box, then, clicking open, the 'Add Attachments' browser does not appear. Do take note that this issue appears randomly and might take a long time to reproduce.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head to an Issue and scroll down to the comment box.
 # Click on the *Attachments* button and browse an attachment. Then, click *Select*.

h3. Expected Results

The 'Add Attachments' browser appears.
h3. Actual Results

The 'Add Attachments' browser does not appear.
h3. Workaround

Add Attachment dialog was removed in Jira 8.4, now the file is attached immediately without popping up that dialog. You can upgrade to version 8.4 and higher.
fields.summary: When browsing for attachments in a comment box, then, clicking open, the 'Add Attachments' browser does not appear.

fields.description:
getScheme(id) of com.atlassian.jira.workflow.workflowSchemeManager.java is deprecated since v5.0. 
We used getSchemeObject(Long).
But this method returns Scheme Object instead of GenericValue.
When we try to add Workflow to this retrieved Scheme object from 'getSchemeObject(Long)',
there is no method available in WorkflowSchemeManager to use Scheme Object. As currently available method i.e. addWorkflowToScheme(org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue scheme, String workflowName, String issueTypeId) needs Generic Value type object.

Kindly suggest a solution which can work !
fields.summary: Need alternative of method named "addWorkflowToScheme(GenericValue , String , String )" defined in com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowSchemeManager so as to pass parameter of type "Scheme Object instead of GenericValue"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using "Plan your upgrade" tool it does not recognize Jira version 8.5 as an Enterprise Release. It only recognizes Jira versions from 7.13.1 until Jira version 7.13.9 as an Enterprise Release.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install or access any Jira version from 7.13.1 until Jira version 7.13.8. (I am using Jira version 7.13.3 as an example for this case)
 # Go to Administration --> Applications --> Plan your upgrade.
 # Click on the "Upgrade to" Jira version and look for Jira version 8.5, you will not see an "Enterprise Release" next to it.
 # Scroll to Jira version 7.13.9, you will see "Enterprise Release" next to it. This proves that Jira recognizes Jira version 7.13.9 as the latest "Enterprise Release".

h3. Expected Results
When using the "Plan your upgrade" tool it should recognize Jira version 8.5 as an Enterprise Release.
h3. Actual Results
It only recognizes Jira versions from 7.13.1 until Jira version 7.13.9 as an Enterprise Release.

*  !1.png|thumbnail! 
*  !2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: "Plan your upgrade" tool is not recognizing Jira version 8.5 as an Enterprise Release

fields.description: Right now the values for first_name and last_name are automatically generated from a supplied "displayName" value by splitting it by space, which causes invalid values to be saved into the database, e.g., displayName "Charlie of Atlassian" is being converted to the first name "Charlie" and "of Atlassian" as a last name, or "Doe, Jane" is converted to "Doe," being a first name and "Jane" being a last name.
fields.summary: Allow specifying first name and last name when creating users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*Configure fields* option in a screen is unable to display all fields if too many fields are associated with the screen scheme.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate many fields (let's say 30 fields) to a screen scheme.
 # Perform any operation in Jira which uses the particular screen, (i.e Create Issue screen)
 # Click on *Configure Fields*

h3. Expected Results

All the fields are displayed in the configure fields menu.
h3. Actual Results

It is not possible to scroll down to view all the fields.
 !1280_720.PNG|thumbnail!

(i) Lower resolution will have a worse effect, despite the [minimum supported display resolution|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver084/supported-platforms-979404246.html] is 1024 x 768.
h3. Workaround

#1 - Reduce the number of fields associated to the screen scheme.

 

#2 - 

*1.* With Jira open, resize your browser window so that it's very small as long as you can see the *Create* button.

*2.* Click *Create*.

*3.* With the create screen still open, resize your browser window back to normal.

*4.* Click the *Configure Fields* dropdown. You should have a scroll bar that allows you to go all the way down.
fields.summary: Configure fields option in a screen is unable to display all fields if too many fields are associated to the screen scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing available upgrade versions in the Jira UI, Jira 8.5 is not designated an Enterprise Release. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Jira Settings > Applications > Plan your upgrade. 
 # Use the drop-down menu under "Upgrade To".

h3. Expected Results

We should see a designation that matches the previous Enterprise Release designation.
h3. Actual Results

We do not see an Enterprise designation.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira 8.5 is not labeled "Enterprise Release" in Plan Your Upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding the same user group from local and active directory causes unexpected results. Variation on this can occur using the same name but with one letter cased differently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# add at least one active directory in Jira's User Directories
# create a local group, for example 'Production'. Add a global share permission to the group, in Jira.
# create a group in the added User Directory, for example 'production', add some users to it

h3. Expected Results

The groups are seen separately in Jira and function independently. Global share permission can be removed or added to each group.

h3. Actual Results

The groups are merged. The local user memberships are no longer visible. 
Also some functionalities like removing global share permissions can no longer be controlled (as removing fails silently).

h3. Workaround

Global share permission can be removed from database directly, for example:
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM public.globalpermissionentry WHERE PERMISSION='CREATE_SHARED_OBJECTS' AND GROUP_ID='jira-test'
{code}

Notes

see also:
# https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66032 (when using same group name)
# https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66599 (when using same group name + space)
fields.summary: Adding the same group from different directories has unexpected results

fields.description:
The current JQL contain operator(~) is not an actual contain based on the implementation is to match a stem word.

It will retrieve the issues contain the following words.
 * customized

 * customs

 What will be really good feature is to have the followings:

text ~ "tom"

It will return any string with tom as substring.

 

Any thought on have this feature?
fields.summary: JQL Contains to implement substring match

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When upgrading Jira, customers may face issues related to scripts in the Announcement Banner or custom fields from Jira. Due to changes on Jira and its plugins, keeping scripts on Jira may cause certain pages to break, and we have no explicit warnings regarding that.

h3. Suggested Solution

Update our documentation to alert about this behavior, avoiding possible issues during upgrades.
fields.summary: Edit our upgrade documentation to include warnings related to scripts on Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After the change of colours for issue statuses in Jira 8.2.0 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard
 # Add Sprint Health Gadget and Filter Results Gadget to the dashboard and configure to display issues in different statuses
 # When displayed next to each other gadgets use different colors for the same statuses 

h3. Expected Results

Each gadget should use the same color for the same status
h3. Actual Results

The Sprint Health Gadget is using yellow for issues in progress.

The Filter Results Gadget is using blue for issues in progress.

As explained in [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-discussions/New-colors-for-issue-statuses-in-conflict-with-agile-gadgets/m-p/1209358]
h3. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget colors to match the new colors for issue statuses released in Jira 8.2.0

fields.description:
h2. Preamble

As of JIRA 8.x, the way the email velocity templates are modified is different from the previous JIRA versions.
 Before JIRA 8.x, customers could include an *Issue Field* by following this article: [adding custom-fields to email|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/adding-custom-fields-to-email/]

As of JIRA 8.x, the method no longer works as the structure of the batched notifications is now different.
 A new [method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/adding-custom-fields-to-emails-batched-notifications-968669988.html] exists to add *Custom Fields* to the Velocity templates, but the method is not suitable for *Issue Fields*.

The purpose of this feature request is to track customers interest in being able to add *Issue Fields* to batch notifications and also to document a workaround that customers can implement if adding system field to document is a must in the meantime.
fields.summary: Adding Issue fields to batch notifications emails

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently how Epic burndown chart behaves is if we close the tickets during other sprint active time though that ticket belongs to other sprint , Epic burndown chart will show it in the sprint in which it is closed 

We would like this behavior to be changed say there should be some margin/time given to the reporter to close that ticket belong to the sprint  and should show in the sprint in Epic burndown chart to which it actually belongs rather show in other sprint time.

 

Thank you
fields.summary: Need some margin to close the issues/ticket within the active sprints without effecting Epic burndown chart

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Searching using Russian keyboard for the word "Создано" it doesn't show up because the first letter of the word is from the English keyboard. Not in Russian keyboard which causes issues. The letters might look the same but the formatting is different.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Switch your profile language to Russian
# Go to any issue and press Ctrl+F to start a simple search in your browser
# Using English keyboard type the letter "C" 
# "Cоздано" will show up in the search which is incorrect
# Now search using a Russian keyboard type "С" or you can copy this

h4. Another way to Reproduce
# Currently, Press Ctrl+F to start a simple search in your browser.
# Using English keyboard type the letter "C" and observe the statement below.
#* Russian version with bug. Simple check with
#** Cоздано - the bug. "C" is from the English keyboard.
 #*** !English C.png|thumbnail! 
#** Создано - correct. "С" is from the Russian keyboard.
#*** !russian C.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
When searching for the word "Создано" using Russian keyboard, the search should return results. 
h3. Actual Results
When searching for the word "Создано" using Russian keyboard, the search does not return any results because the first letter is from the English keyboard. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Searching using Russian keyboard for the word "Создано" it doesn't show up
